alert.note: Alert for Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 9:44PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Washington Parish in southeastern Louisiana and northwestern Pearl River Counties through 1015 PM CST... At 943 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bogalusa, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bogalusa, Poplarville, Varnado, Crossroads and Angie. This includes Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 26 and 27. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CST for southeastern Louisiana...and southern Mississippi.
